examples.description: Given the current date is 2020-01-01 -> And a UK Limited Company which was started on 2019-01-01 -> And its first accounting year ends on 2019-12-31 -> And the company has CIS categories -> And it has a contact in United Kingdom named Winston Churchill set to always charge VAT -> And they are running payroll in the 2020 tax year on the 25th of each month -> And a Alternate Arrangements payroll profile with Tax Code 1100L -> And they are paid £2000 monthly -> And a sent invoice to Winston Churchill dated on 2019-04-10 -> And the CIS deduction rate on the invoice is set at 20% -> And a CIS line item is added for £5000 with 0% VAT -> And adding a payment in 750-1 for £4000 dated 2019-04-10 to the invoice -> And it should be valid -> Given postgrad loan deduction applies -> When running payroll for a period -> Then the payroll period should have ledger entries -> And the "CIS Deductions" account should be £438.10 in debit -> And the "PAYE/NI" account should be empty
examples.full_description: Payroll 19/20 Ledger Builder CIS (Subcontractors) Postgrad loan payments offset again CIS deductions Given the current date is 2020-01-01 -> And a UK Limited Company which was started on 2019-01-01 -> And its first accounting year ends on 2019-12-31 -> And the company has CIS categories -> And it has a contact in United Kingdom named Winston Churchill set to always charge VAT -> And they are running payroll in the 2020 tax year on the 25th of each month -> And a Alternate Arrangements payroll profile with Tax Code 1100L -> And they are paid £2000 monthly -> And a sent invoice to Winston Churchill dated on 2019-04-10 -> And the CIS deduction rate on the invoice is set at 20% -> And a CIS line item is added for £5000 with 0% VAT -> And adding a payment in 750-1 for £4000 dated 2019-04-10 to the invoice -> And it should be valid -> Given postgrad loan deduction applies -> When running payroll for a period -> Then the payroll period should have ledger entries -> And the "CIS Deductions" account should be £438.10 in debit -> And the "PAYE/NI" account should be empty
